intro: Escobaria tuberculosa subsp. varicolor, commonly known as the variegated stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves with distinctive yellow or white markings. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Its compact growth habit and striking foliage make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
